question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
Full-Solution Problems. Justify your answers and show all your work.
Simplification of answers is not required.

 Evaluate the following integral.

$\int\frac{x^{2}}{(x^{3}+1)^{101}}\, dx$
sols:
We proceed via the hint. Let $u = x^{3} + 1$ so that $du = 3x^{2}dx$ and
so

\begin{align*}
\int\frac{x^{2}}{(x^{3}+1)^{101}}\, dx &= \frac{1}{3}\int \frac{du}{u^{101}} \\
&= \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{-100u^{100}} + C \\
&= \frac{1}{-300(x^{3} + 1)^{100}} + C\end{align*}

completing the question.
hints: This question is ripe for a substitution
